helpgrid.innerhtml: A lot of menu testing can be done via the Goto Menu and Toolbar Comboboxes. They can have multiple submenus, some are more than one level deep.
There is also a context menu that is used in App Designer.

Considerations for menus are:
  • Positioning
    • Comboboxes drop below field. Check on Toolbar, main form and dialog. (left aligned / Bidi is right aligned)
    • Detail Menus drop below image (to the right / Bidi is to the left)
    • Goto Menu Drops below link (to the right / Bidi is to the left)
  • Keystrokes
    • Up and down arrows navigate items within a menu. Disabled items can be navigated, but no other interaction
    • Left and right arrows navigate to and from sub menus. Right arrow will open a sub and left will close it (In Bidi these reverse)
    • Enter toggles a menu item or opens a sub menu / Escape will close a menu and focus on the parent menu or item that opened the menu
  • Focus
    • When a menu is opened the first item should get focus *(exceptions: submenus opened by mouseover / typeahead menus)
    • when a sub menu is closed the parent item should get focus *(exception: submenus closed by mouseover)
    • when a top level menu is closed the element that popped the menu should get focus
  • Bidi
    • Pop locations reversed
    • Backgrounds and general layout reversed
    • Sub menu pop locations reversed
    • Left and right arrows reversed
  • Accessibility
    • WAI-ARIA TAGS and Keystroke navigation using arrows
    • ROLES: menu / menuitem
    • aria-disabled (for disabled items) / aria-haspopup (for items with a sub menu) / aria-label (on textnode of item)
Make sure to test menus with different window sizes to make sure we have sizing, pop location and direction should work.

helpgrid.innerhtml: This is NOT finished TODO finish it.
Choosing A or B in the 'ALN domain with two items: A and B:' field should change the value in the 'Shared attribute' field because they are bound to the same attribute.
The attributes the next two fields are bound to have a getList() method and therefore they aren't simple, and shouldn't have typeahead because its not explicitly configured.

The data available in the type ahead on the next field will be limited based on the value in the 'ALN domain with two items: A and B:' field. 1 through 4 will be available it it is blank, 1 and 2 if it is A, and 3 and 4 if it is B. When a value is selected the description is set into the 'Alphanumeric (10)' field as a result of a setvalue defined on the datasource.
Note: in a production app this same filter behavior should be included in the business logic as well.
Type an '&' in the field and ensure that you get just one match.
Type '&a' in the field and ensure that you get just one match. Also type '&amp;' in the field and make sure that no matches are found

The first here has a field validation class that will throw an exception in validate() if it's value does not start with A (it will allow an empty string).
If validate() passes, the action() will add a warning if the second field is empty.
No lookup specified. Date and DateTime shouldn't have a button, Time gets one automatically
Datetime lookup specified. Auto corrected to match actual type if Date, DateTime, or Time.
Date lookup specified. Auto corrected to match actual type if Date, DateTime, or Time.
Lookup specified and readonly. Clicking the lookup should do nothing.
